replies.body: don't play fiora please, she's one of the most toxic one tricks i've ever seen.

Hey man!

I know the feels of picking up a new champ (currently picking up Rumble top and ALL the assassins mid....mainly want to play Kat and Talon). 

I'm not a pro player by any means but I know a little bit about Fiora so hopefully the below can help =D

Her KEY ability is Riposte. Remember to save it for crucial abilities and CC. Higher level players tend to use W less than lower tier players. By holding onto riposte as long as possible you can force the opponent to hold their key ability as well.

http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/page/turbo-mode-data-behind-your-spell-spamming

Try to think about each death, and if you could have used Riposte better.

Obviously the basics of Fiora are to make sure you use your mobility to proc the vitals.

In terms of moving outside of lanning phase and into mid game/late game remember Fiora is a duelist. She excels at 1v1's or maybe even 1v2's, effectively pressuring other lanes while your team is pressuring at the same time is what you want to be doing with Fiora.

If you do need to jump into the fray as a team fight breaks out, flanking the AP/AD carry is usually the thing you want to be doing. Fiora isn't tanky enough most times to walk through the front line CC and go for the back line. Usually flanking allows you to get into that duel scenario with priority targets without having to use too many cool downs getting there.

Item's - Fiora relies on damage and sustain. So make sure you build for it. I see you are building Hydra which is good. But Tri force and ghost blade I don't think are ideal.

* Flank

The rest is situational and will come down to experience =D good luck man!
